intro: Lithocardium blanchetii, commonly known as the rock starflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. Its leaves are small, fleshy, and often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Lithocardium blanchetii is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
